Creating Promotion States

When creating promotion states, many administrators assign <current> to the initial promotion state instead of a view label, because that state always uses the tip revisions. They also often assign <current> to later promotion states for which no view labels currently exist. These states may receive a view label later, when the files associated with a view label meet the criteria required by the state. Alternatively, a view label may be promoted from the preceding state to the label-less state.

You can create promotion states only if you have the required access rights, which are found at the project or view level.

To create promotion states:

  1. Select View > Promotion. The Promotion dialog displays the states currently created for this view. The final state appears at the top of the list.

  2. Click Add. The Promotion State dialog opens.

  3. Enter the name of a promotion state name in the Name text box.

  4. Enter its description in the Description text box.

  5. Assign a view label to this state by selecting it from the View Label drop-down list box. The labels are listed in reverse chronological order, based on the time at which they were created. You can change the label when appropriate by using this dialog box or assign it to the next state by promoting it.

  6. To change a selected state's name, description, or view label, click Edit. To delete a state, click Delete.

  7. Click OK. No changes are saved to the server until you click OK or Apply.

    8. Note: You can return to the list of states on the server by clicking the Reset button. The list reverts to the states that were available when you opened the Promotion State dialog or when you last clicked Apply.

  8. Repeat steps 2 through 5 to add additional promotion states. The final state should appear at the top of the list. If you accidentally enter the promotion states in the wrong order, you can rearrange them by using the Move Up and Move Down buttons.
